bug.short_desc: Could not parse desktop file baloo_file.desktop
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I have both the Gnome and KDE environments installed. Since upgrading to Fedora 24 which replaces kactivities-nepomuk with kf5-baloo-file the following error is logged in journald: Aug 15 10:49:24 formenos.lan gnome-session[2005]: gnome-session-binary[2005]: WARNING: Could not parse desktop file baloo_file.desktop or it references a not found TryExec binary Aug 15 10:49:24 formenos.lan gnome-session-binary[2005]: WARNING: Could not parse desktop file baloo_file.desktop or it references a not found TryExec binary
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): Fedora 24 [m8ram@formenos ~]$ rpm -q kf5-baloo-file gnome-settings-daemon kf5-baloo-file-5.25.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gnome-settings-daemon-3.20.1-3.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Occurs at every boot
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install kf5-baloo-file 2. boot 3. Log in to Gnome session
Actual results: Error logged
Expected results: No errors logged.
Additional info:
[m8ram@formenos ~]$ desktop-file-validate /etc/xdg/autostart/baloo_file.desktop --warn-kde /etc/xdg/autostart/baloo_file.desktop: warning: value "Service" for key "Type" in group "Desktop Entry" is a reserved value for KDE /etc/xdg/autostart/baloo_file.desktop: error: key "Exec" is present in group "Desktop Entry", but the type is "Service" while this key is only valid for type "Application"
Fixed in rawhide, will get rolled into next KF5 bugfix update
